pullrequest.title: Download a model from Ignition Fuel

pull_request.title: Download a model from Ignition Fuel

update.description:
With this pull request the GUI should be able to download models hosted in an Ignition Fuel server. We can only download simple models, not models that contain references to other models.

![fuel_insert_model.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3626697554-fuel_insert_model.gif)

~~*Note: this PR is built atop pull request #2796, which should be merged first. [Here's](#!/osrf/gazebo/branches/compare/fuel_download%0Dfuel#diff) a better diff.*~~

content.raw: +1. You need ignition common to use this, so might as well use use it instead of boost.
content.html: +1. You need ignition common to use this, so might as well use use it instead of boost.

pull_request.title: Download a model from Ignition Fuel

pullrequest.title: Download a model from Ignition Fuel

content.raw: Fair enough, I just thought that we've been trying not to add any new boost, and since this file is only built when ign-common is present I thought we might as well use it. But I don't feel too strongly about this, we can leave it as it is.
content.html: Fair enough, I just thought that we've been trying not to add any new boost, and since this file is only built when ign-common is present I thought we might as well use it. But I don't feel too strongly about this, we can leave it as it is.

content.raw: Not sure if we're gaining something using ign-common here because we would have to declare it as an explicit dependency for Gazebo. And we're already using `boost::filesystem` anyway.
content.html: Not sure if we're gaining something using ign-common here because we would have to declare it as an explicit dependency for Gazebo. And we're already using boost::filesystem anyway.

content.html: Just checking: does it make sense to use gazebo::common::URI here?

pull_request.title: Download a model from Ignition Fuel

pullrequest.title: Download a model from Ignition Fuel

content.raw:
I took the liberty of retargeting this PR to the `fuel` branch (pull request #2796) to make the diff easier to look at. (I know we could click the link above, but I think this way we make sure everyone is looking at the same thing). 

We can retarget to default after that has been merged. Feel free to revert this if you think it's a bad idea.
content.html:
I took the liberty of retargeting this PR to the fuel branch (pull request #2796) to make the diff easier to look at. (I know we could click the link above, but I think this way we make sure everyone is looking at the same thing).

We can retarget to default after that has been merged. Feel free to revert this if you think it's a bad idea.
